dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter gets him untangled, and the two RACE away from the coop, running for all they're worth as a FLASHLIGHT hits one, then the other. They RUN --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and David catches one last glimpse of Walter running, heading for the line of trees....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the last you saw of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the interview continues.   David nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last I saw of any of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you don't know if either of the other two were captured?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. All I know is, if he hadn't come back for me...I don't think I ever would've gotten out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened after that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hid in the woods for two days, too scared to move, because I was sure they'd find me. I finally started walking, but every time a car came up I was afraid it was them. So I kept off the main roads until I saw a train stopped at a crossing, and I jumped in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHANGELING A True Story

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell anyone what had happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid! I thought they'd come after me, or my folks...so I didn't tell anybody. I was on my own until I got a free meal from this lady, Mrs. Lansing. I told her I was an orphan, on my own. She said I could stay on, and...I did. (beat) Every night, I'd wake up, thinking they were right outside my window. Then I heard the police talking on the radio about what happened at the ranch, and I thought, for sure I can't go back now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I didn't tell anybody what happened, I was afraid they'd blame me for those kids being dead. So I just...stayed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what made you come forward now, after all this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David looks away, his eyes tearing up.   Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss my mom...I miss my dad...I just...I just want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all Mrs. Clay can take. Sobbing, she runs out of the viewing room and into the interview room, where she g to her son and embraces him, holds him, the two crying in one another's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine and Ybarra watch as Mr. and Mrs. Clay lead thei son into their car. As they drive off, Christine finally breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still can't believe it. Five years, case closed, everyone thinks he's dead...and there he is. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHANGELING A True Story

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YBARRA (Cont'd) And he wouldn't be, if it wasn't for Walter. (beat) Your son did a brave thing, Mrs. Collins. You should be very proud of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think he's still out there, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? Three boys made a run for it that night, Detective. If one got out, maybe either or both of the others did too. Maybe Walter went through the same fears he did. Afraid to come home or identify himself, afraid he'd get into trouble, that people might think it was his fault. Either way, it gives me something I didn't have before tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him...and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks off into the night, as we SUPERIMPOSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon Stewart Northcott was hanged on October 2, 1935

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In exchange for his cooperation and a guilty plea, Sanfor Wesley Clark was sentenced to the Whittier State School f Boys for five years. Upon being released in 1934, he retu home to Canada, and was never heard from again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon returning to duty after his suspension, Captain J. J Jones was demoted to Lieutenant and subsequently sued by Christine Collins in civil court. He was found guilty and fined $10,800 (equal to $125,000 in 2006 dollars). He nev paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One year after the City Council recommended the removal o the Los Angeles Chief of Police, James E Davis resigned f office and was replaced by Roy E. Steckel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHANGELING A True Story

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis reclaimed that office in 1933, where he created the Squad, notorious for attacking Communists and their offic but was forced to resign a second time under a cloud of p corruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the aftermath of the City Council hearings, the crimin justice system in California was revised to prevent women from being incarcerated or institutionalized for the crim disagreeing with a male police officer. Strict medical procedures were set in place to prevent future abuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In November 1929, Los Angeles Mayor George E. Cryer was v out of office after three terms. He was later found to ha been the front man for the Crawford Organized Crime Syndi which ran prostitution and gambling rackets throughout So California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the rest of his life, Reverend Gustav A. Briegleb use his radio show to expose police misconduct and political corruption. He also published "The Layman's Handbook of Daniel."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The California community of Wineville, near Riverside, be synonymous with the infamous Northcott Murder Ranch. In o to shake free of the scandal, the residents changed its n to Mira Loma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christine Collins never stopped searching for her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fate of Walter Collins remains a mystery. If he was a to escape the Northcott Ranch, he would be 86 years old t
